author: Lucille Liu
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will be joined by Russia’s Vladimir Putin and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un Wednesday for a once-a-decade military parade that will unveil new weapons and showcase Beijing’s diplomatic clout.
title: Xi, Putin and Kim to Appear Together at China’s Military Parade

author: Myles Miller
description: The United States Secret Service’s counter sniper unit operated at nearly three-quarters below its required staffing level for four years, according to a Department of Homeland Security Inspector General review that stemmed from the 2024 assassination attempt on Donald Trump.
title: Inspector General Says Secret Service Sniper Team Understaffed

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Two Brazilian centrist parties have ordered his members to resign from cabinet positions as they prepare to support candidates who may challenge President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in next year’s elections.
title: Two Centrist Parties Pull Out of Lula’s Cabinet Eyeing 2026 Vote

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Longshot independent candidate Jim Walden dropped out of the New York City mayoral race and urged other lagging candidates to make way for a single challenger to take on Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani.
title: NYC Mayoral Candidate Jim Walden Ends His ‘Futile’ Campaign

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth will allow Pentagon lawyers to serve as immigration judges to address a surge in cases, further deepening his department’s involvement in President Donald Trump’s deportation crackdown.
title: Pentagon Agrees to Lend Its Lawyers Out as Immigration Judges

author: Peter Blumberg, Jamie Tarabay
description: President Donald Trump has repeatedly deployed the US military for domestic assignments. In June, he summoned the Guard and the Marines to Los Angeles — over the objections of local leaders — to subdue protests against his administration’s mass arrests of migrants. And in August, Trump called up the Guard to combat violent street crime in Washington, DC.
title: Why Trump’s Use of Military in US Is So Controversial

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Caitlin Reilly looks at the prospects for Republicans passing another party-line tax and spending bill. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: GOP Faces a Tougher Road to Passing ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ 2.0

author: Caitlin Reilly, Erin Slowey
description: Workers in dozens of job categories — including waiters, cosmetologists, golf caddies, event DJs and dancers — won’t have to pay taxes on the tips they earn, according to a White House list published on Tuesday.
title: Golf Caddies, Influencers to Be Exempted from Taxes on Tips

author: Lauren Dezenski, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump says he’s not looking at lowering tariffs on India, one week after the US doubled levies on the country’s imports to 50% as punishment for its Russian oil imports.
title: Trump Says Not Considering Lowering Tariffs on India Imports

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The Trump administration is rolling out quarterly bonuses of as much as $1,000 for state and local police officers who meet immigration-arrest targets, escalating its enforcement crackdown.
title: US to Offer $1,000 Bonuses to Police for Help Arresting Migrants

author: Erik Larson, Laura Curtis
description: The vast majority of President Donald Trump’s tariffs remain in limbo after a federal appeals court ruled that they were issued illegally under an emergency law while agreeing to keep them in place while the case proceeds. The US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit on Aug. 29 upheld an earlier decision by the US Court of International Trade. Both courts concluded that Trump wrongfully invoked an emergency law, the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), to justify the duties —
title: Will Trump Tariffs Survive Lawsuits? What to Know About the Legal Battle

author: Lauren Dezenski, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said his administration would ask the Supreme Court for an expedited ruling in hopes of overturning a federal court decision that many of his tariffs were illegally imposed, arguing it is essential to keep his trade policy intact.
title: Trump to Ask Supreme Court for Expedited Ruling on Tariffs

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal judge in Washington likely won’t rule before Sept. 4 in the fight over President Donald Trump’s move to oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook after giving the government more time to submit arguments in the case.
title: Trump Fed Firing Ruling Not Expected Until After Sept. 4 Filing

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Andreina Itriago
description: President Donald Trump said the US military targeted a boat carrying drugs from Venezuela, touting the administration’s success after deploying naval vessels to the Caribbean as part of a push to stop narco-trafficking.
title: Trump Says Military Hit Boat Carrying Drugs from Venezuela

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump has moved to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook following a claim by a top administration official that she may have engaged in so-called mortgage occupancy fraud by falsely labeling a secondary home as her primary residence to get better loan terms. Cook hasn’t been charged with any crimes, but the allegation put a spotlight on what experts say is a relatively common type of financial misconduct.
title: What Is the Mortgage Fraud Lisa Cook Is Accused Of?

author: Stephanie Hughes
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford slammed beverage firm Diageo Plc’s decision to end bottling operations in his province for a Canadian whisky that was created in the country.
title: Ontario Premier Dumps Diageo Whiskey on Ground to Protest Plant Closure

author: Ewa Krukowska, John Ainger
description: France is pushing to elevate discussions on the European Union’s next climate goal to the leaders’ level, setting the stage for a clash over the speed and direction of the transition.
title: France Pushes for EU Leaders to Weigh In on 2040 Climate Goal

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson, Andrea Palasciano
description: The US said it disapproves of any creative accounting by European allies to reach a new NATO spending target, putting Italy on the spot as the government weighs whether to count the construction of the world’s longest suspension bridge as military expenditure.
title: US Pushes Back on Italy Counting Sicily Bridge as NATO Defense

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson, Andrea Dudik, Natalia Drozdiak
description: The US has held back from imposing secondary sanctions on China over its support for Russia’s war on Ukraine because broader trade negotiations are continuing, the US’s envoy to NATO said Tuesday.
title: US Holds Back China Trade Threats as It Weighs Russia Sanctions

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Earlier this year, ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast looked like a has-been, with few leading economists or politicians showing appetite to join in his third presidential run. Fast forward six months, and well-known figures are jumping ship from a rival coalition to team up with his campaign.
title: Chile Presidential Hopeful Poaches Talent From Floundering Rival

author: Myles Miller
description: The death count rose through the long weekend. By Tuesday morning, Chicago police said eight people were killed. More than 50 people had been shot, including seven in a single drive-by.
title: Eight Deaths, 58 Shootings in Chicago Fuel Trump’s Troop Threats

author: Roxana Tiron, Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump is set to announce that he’s basing US Space Command in Huntsville, Alabama, undoing former President Joe Biden’s decision to put the headquarters in Colorado.
title: Trump Set to Announce US Space Command Will Move to Alabama

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Africa’s poorest countries are struggling to take on more debt to invest in agriculture and are increasingly faced with the stark choice of paying off costly loans or feeding their people, global development leaders have warned.
title: Africa’s Food Needs, Debt Costs Create Nightmare For Lenders

author: Iain Rogers
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz offered Germany’s support for Switzerland in its bid to reduce the punishingly high trade levy US President Donald Trump imposed on the export-dependent nation last month.
title: Merz Offers to Help Swiss Reduce ‘Exorbitant’ Trump Trade Tariff

author: Madlin Mekelburg, Erik Larson
description: A US judge ruled President Donald Trump’s deployment of National Guard troops to Los Angeles during June protests against his immigration crackdown violated federal law.
title: Trump’s LA Troop Deployment Violated Federal Law, Judge Says

author: Julian Lee
description: Flows to India are close to the lowest in nine months; China at the highest since March
title: Russia’s Oil Cargoes Flood to China as Tariffs Crimp India Flows

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: The former president of Brazil, Jair Bolsonaro, is on trial at the country’s highest court, charged with plotting a coup following his 2022 election defeat. If found guilty, the right-wing populist could be sentenced to prison for decades.
title: What’s at Stake for Brazil as Bolsonaro Trial Verdict Nears

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s coalition government is under renewed strain after Prime Minister Ilie Bolojan warned that disagreements over a public administration overhaul risk derailing a wider fiscal reform package.
title: Romanian Coalition Faces New Tensions Over Planned Spending Cuts

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s largest political party, courted by two rival groups bidding to form a new government after last week’s dismissal of Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, said it will decide on Wednesday whom to back as new leader.
title: Kingmaker Thai Party Nears Decision on Support for New Premier

author: Ben Sills
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said reaching consensus on security guarantees for Ukraine was possible, even as he reiterated Moscow would never accept Kyiv’s accession into NATO.
title: Putin Says Consensus on Security Guarantees for Ukraine Possible

author: Colum Murphy, Lucille Liu
description: President Xi Jinping used a mix of bonhomie and economic allure this week to send Donald Trump a clear message: Beijing has too much global clout to be dictated by the US.
title: China’s Xi Redraws Geopolitical Map With Embrace of Putin, Modi

author: Lucy White
description: The UK’s Green Party elected Zack Polanski as its new leader, signaling a move to the populist left for the climate-focused group.
title: UK Green Party Elects Zack Polanski as Leader in Populist Shift

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Rivals for centuries, China and Russia now have a de facto alliance, even if it’s failed to reach the high “no limits” bar that Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin set just weeks before Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. The economic, military and political ties nurtured over the past decade between the world’s two most powerful authoritarian states — both of which aim to upend at least parts of the US-dominated post-Cold War order — have grown as a result of the war, despite Ch
title: Why Putin and Xi Are ‘Best Friends’

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: House Republican leaders face powerful headwinds as they return to Washington to push for a second major tax and spending bill this year designed to meet fiscal conservatives’ demands for deeper federal budget cuts.
title: GOP Faces Headwinds on Push for Second Big Tax and Spending Bill

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: President Prabowo Subianto is confronting his biggest test since winning power last year
title: Indonesian Riots Ask Hard Questions of Prabowo

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkey’s main opposition party raised the prospect of the mayor of Ankara being its next presidential candidate, amid a clampdown that’s seen its most popular official and several others jailed.
title: Turkey Opposition Chief Mulls New Candidate to Challenge Erdogan

author: Max Ramsay
description: Belgium’s government reached a deal to recognize Palestine as a state and adopt punitive measures against Israel, avoiding a political crisis over an issue that had split the governing coalition.
title: Belgian Coalition Averts Crisis With Move to Recognize Palestine

author: Claire Jiao
description: Indonesia is experiencing its worst civil unrest in years after government plans to give the country’s lawmakers a $3,000 monthly housing allowance triggered a wave of popular indignation in a country suffering from endemic poverty and joblessness.
title: What’s Behind the Violent Protests Across Indonesia?

author: Deana Kjuka
description: A Chinese decision to test visa-free entry for Russian citizens may boost tourism and business trips by 30% to 40%, according to a Russian lobby group.
title: Visa-Free China Entry May Boost Russian Trips by 40%, Lobby Says

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: President Donald Trump said India offered to cut tariffs, while New Delhi signaled it’s continuing to negotiate a trade agreement with the US, indicating both sides are keeping the door open to resolving tensions.
title: US, India Keep Door Open to Trade Talks Despite Tariff Tensions

author: Yian Lee
description: The former head of Taiwan’s main opposition party will attend a major military parade in Beijing, defying the government in Taipei, which has called on citizens not to go.
title: Ex-Chair of Taiwan Opposition Party to Attend Xi’s Parade

author: Andrea Dudik
description: Czech election frontrunner and billionaire, Andrej Babis, said he was taking a brief break from intense campaigning after he was attacked at a rally by a man with a walking stick.
title: Election Favorite Takes Campaign Break After Czech Rally Attack

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand’s Senate approved a 3.78 trillion baht ($117 billion) annual budget, offering relief to investors concerned about political uncertainty following the sacking of Paetongtarn Shinawatra as prime minister last week.
title: Thai Senate Clears Budget as Parties Scramble to Form Government

author: James Mayger
description: Outside a rain swept mountaintop museum where Chinese forces fought a key battle against Japan in 1940, footage of President Xi Jinping last month blared out of a giant television.
title: Xi Wages ‘Memory War’ on China’s WWII History With Eye on Taiwan

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin met briefly in Beijing, providing a reminder of the close relationship the two have developed since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Xi, Putin Meet in Beijing, Highlighting Their Close Ties

author: Samy Adghirni
description: France’s far-right National Rally said it’s ready for fresh elections as the country girds for the current government’s likely collapse on Monday.
title: French Far Right Builds Momentum as Premier Heads Toward Exit

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan will handle US demands to buy more American rice within the confines of its existing overall cap on duty-free imports and has no plans to lower its tariffs on farm products, according to Tokyo’s top trade negotiator.
title: Japan to Buy US Rice Within Overall Limit on Duty-Free Imports

author: Chiranjivi Chakraborty, Savio Shetty
description: India’s securities regulator is imposing further restrictions on equity-index options trading in a bid to curb speculation, just months after its crackdown on Jane Street Group for alleged manipulation.
title: India Tightens Equity-Options Rules Again After Jane Street Saga

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s ruling party on Tuesday will disclose its findings on why it lost so many seats in a July upper house election, in a report that’s likely to indicate how much longer Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba can expect to stay in office.
title: Review of LDP Election Setback to Sway Japan PM Ishiba’s Future

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un unveiled a plan to develop a new intercontinental ballistic missile, renewing his push to advance the country’s weapons program just as he prepared to arrive in Beijing for rare meetings with his Chinese and Russian counterparts.
title: North Korea Shows Off ICBM Plan as Kim Prepares for China Visit
